Class InvalidInput

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.RuntimeException
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Exceptions.InvalidInput
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class InvalidInput extends RuntimeException
Thrown to indicate that an invalid input has been provided. This exception is used to signal that input values or parameters do not meet the expected criteria or constraints for a particular operation or context. This exception may include additional contextual information about the invalid input, such as specific coordinates or error details.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • InvalidInput

      public InvalidInput(String message)
      Constructs an InvalidInput exception with the specified detail message. This constructor is used to signal an invalid input scenario with an accompanying error message providing details about the nature of the invalid input.
      Parameters:
      message - the detail message describing the specific cause or context of the invalid input

    • InvalidInput

      public InvalidInput(int x, int y, String message)
      Constructs an InvalidInput exception with specific coordinates and a detailed error message. This exception is used to indicate that the provided coordinates are invalid for the intended operation.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate that caused the exception
      y - the y-coordinate that caused the exception
      message - the detail message explaining the cause of the exception

  • Method Details

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Retrieves the x-coordinate associated with this exception.
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate value indicating a specific detail about the invalid input

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Retrieves the value of the 'y' coordinate associated with this instance.
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the 'y' coordinate

    • getErrorDetails

      public String getErrorDetails()
      Retrieves the detailed error message associated with this exception. This string typically provides additional context or information about the nature and specifics of the exception.
      Returns:
      a string containing the error details for further diagnostic or informational purposes
